alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 01 at 11:48AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall and runoff. * WHERE...A portion of Yavapai County in western Arizona, near Dewey-Humboldt and along portions of the Agua Fria River. * WHEN...Until 115 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Water flowing over roadways will create slick paved roads and muddy unpaved roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1146 AM MST, Doppler radar indicated the heavy rain has ended across the advised area. However, minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the area as water drains. Between 0.75 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Agua Fria River, Ash Creek, Osborne Spring Wash, Lynx Creek, Big Bug Creek, Chaparral Gulch, Yarber Wash and Brushy Wash. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Prescott Valley, Dewey-humboldt and Poland Junction. - This includes the following highways... State Route 69 between mile markers 276 and 285. Interstate 17 between mile markers 265 and 266. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
